author: P V
text:
Demands include increase in passengers, hours of operation

: The coracle operators here have entered into the third-day of strike demanding relaxation of safety norms.

The stand-off between the coracle operators and the administration has been continuing for several months now with the operators alleging that the safety norms were restrictive and impeding tourism. The operators have demanded that the number of passengers on coracle be increased from four persons to six.

Round-the-year service

They also want round-the-year coracle service as opposed to the administration’s caveats based on water level in Cauvery river.

Similarly, they have also demanded increase in timing of coracle operation hours from 7 a.m to 6 p.m as opposed to the current timing of 10 a.m to 5 p.m.

The norms came into place in September last after a coracle capsized killing six members of a family.

Intermittent strikes

Coracleoperators, who initially came around to accepting the norms, however, have been on intermittent strikes demanding that the norms be relaxed especially on certain key points, including permission for children to go on rides.

However, the administration had refused to reduce the permissible age down from seven years.
title: Coracle operators go on strike, want norms relaxed
